verses.verse: "Isn't <S%H582><s%> a man forced to labor on earth? <S%H776><s%> Aren't <S%H3117><s%> his days like the days <S%H3117><s%> of a hired hand? <S%H7916><s%>
As a servant <S%H5650><s%> who earnestly desires <S%H7602><s%> the shadow, <S%H6738><s%> as a hireling <S%H7916><s%> who looks <S%H6960><s%> for his wages, <S%H6467><s%>
so am I made to possess <S%H5157><s%> months <S%H3391><s%> of misery, <S%H7723><s%> wearisome <S%H5999><s%> nights <S%H3915><s%> are appointed to me. <S%H4487><s%>

When I lie down, <S%H7901><s%> I say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H6965><s%> 'When shall I arise, and the night <S%H6153><s%> be gone? <S%H4059><s%>' I toss <S%H7646><s%> and turn <S%H5076><s%> until the dawning of the day. <S%H5399><s%>

My flesh <S%H1320><s%> is clothed <S%H3847><s%> with worms <S%H7415><s%> and clods <S%H1487><s%> of dust. <S%H6083><s%> My skin <S%H5785><s%> closes up, <S%H7280><s%> and breaks out afresh. <S%H3988><s%>
My days <S%H3117><s%> are swifter <S%H7043><s%> than a weaver <S%H708><s%>'s shuttle, and are spent <S%H3615><s%> without <S%H657><s%> hope. <S%H8615><s%>
Oh remember <S%H2142><s%> that my life <S%H2416><s%> is a breath. <S%H7307><s%> My eye <S%H5869><s%> shall no more <S%H7725><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> good. <S%H2896><s%>
The eye <S%H5869><s%> of him who sees <S%H7789><s%> me shall see <S%H7789><s%> me no more. <S%H5869><s%> Your eyes shall be on me, but I shall not be.
As the cloud <S%H6051><s%> is consumed <S%H3615><s%> and vanishes away, <S%H3212><s%> so he who goes down <S%H3381><s%> to Sheol <S%H7585><s%> shall come up no more. <S%H5927><s%>
He shall return <S%H7725><s%> no more to his house, <S%H1004><s%> neither shall his place <S%H4725><s%> know him any more. <S%H5234><s%>

"Therefore I will not keep <S%H2820><s%> silent. <S%H6310><s%> I will speak <S%H1696><s%> in the anguish <S%H6862><s%> of my spirit. <S%H7307><s%> I will complain <S%H7878><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of my soul. <S%H5315><s%>
Am I a sea, <S%H3220><s%> or a sea monster, <S%H8577><s%> that you put <S%H7760><s%> a guard over me? <S%H4929><s%>
When I say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H6210><s%> 'My bed shall comfort <S%H5162><s%> me. <S%H4904><s%> My couch shall ease <S%H5375><s%> my complaint; <S%H7879><s%>'
then you scare <S%H2865><s%> me with dreams, <S%H2472><s%> and terrify <S%H1204><s%> me through visions: <S%H2384><s%>
so that my soul <S%H5315><s%> chooses <S%H977><s%> strangling, <S%H4267><s%> death <S%H4194><s%> rather than my bones. <S%H6106><s%>
I loathe <S%H3988><s%> my life. <S%H2421><s%> I don't want to live forever. <S%H5769><s%> Leave me alone, <S%H2308><s%> for my days <S%H3117><s%> are but a breath. <S%H1892><s%>
What is man, <S%H582><s%> that you should magnify <S%H1431><s%> him, <S%H7896><s%> that you should set your mind on him, <S%H3820><s%>
that you should visit <S%H6485><s%> him every morning, <S%H1242><s%> and test <S%H974><s%> him every moment? <S%H7281><s%>
How long <S%H4100><s%> will you not look away <S%H8159><s%> from me, <S%H7503><s%> nor leave me alone until I swallow down <S%H1104><s%> my spittle? <S%H7536><s%>

If I have sinned, <S%H2398><s%> what do <S%H6466><s%> I do to you, <S%H5341><s%> you watcher of men? <S%H120><s%> Why have you set <S%H7760><s%> me as a mark <S%H4645><s%> for you, <S%H4853><s%> so that I am a burden to myself?

Why do you not pardon <S%H5375><s%> my disobedience, <S%H6588><s%> and take away <S%H5674><s%> my iniquity? <S%H5771><s%> For now shall I lie down <S%H7901><s%> in the dust. <S%H6083><s%> You will seek me diligently, <S%H7836><s%> but I shall not be."
